00016 struct hash_tab {
00017     const char *id;             
00019     compare_function cmpfn;     
00020     key_function keyfn;         
00021     delete_function delfn;      
00023     unsigned long size;         
00024     struct hash_entry **table;  
00026     unsigned long walk_key;     
00027     struct hash_entry *walk_loc;        
00028     int inside_walk;            
00030     unsigned long entries;      
00031     unsigned long max_entries;  
00033     unsigned long hits;         
00034     unsigned long hits_visited; 
00036     unsigned long misses;       
00037     unsigned long misses_visited;       
00039     unsigned long total_insert; 
00041     struct hash_tab *next;      
00042     struct hash_tab **prev;     
00043 };
00044 
00045 
00046 struct hash_entry {
00047     struct hash_entry *next;    
00048     const void *data;           
00049 };
00050 
00051 #ifndef MALLOC
00052 #define MALLOC(r, t, c)         ((r) = (t *) malloc(sizeof(t)*(c)))
00053 #define FREE(r)                 do { free(r); (r) = 0; } while (0)
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 #ifndef MAKE_ALLOCATOR
00057 #define MAKE_ALLOCATOR(NAME) \
00058     union allocator_##NAME##_un { \
00059         struct NAME info; \
00060         union allocator_##NAME##_un *next; \
00061     }; \
00062     static union allocator_##NAME##_un *available_##NAME##s = NULL; \
00063     static long total_##NAME##s = 0; \
00064     static void generate_##NAME##s(long count) \
00065     { \
00066         union allocator_##NAME##_un *hunk; \
00067         long block_size, num, i; \
00068         while (count > 0) { \
00069             block_size = 4096; \
00070             while ((count * sizeof(union allocator_##NAME##_un)) >= \
00071                    (2*block_size) - 4) { \
00072                 block_size *= 2; \
00073             } \
00074             num = (block_size - 4) / sizeof(union allocator_##NAME##_un); \
00075             MALLOC(hunk, union allocator_##NAME##_un, num); \
00076             if (!hunk) { \
00077                 available_##NAME##s = NULL; \
00078                 return; \
00079             } \
00080             for (i = 0; i < num; i++) { \
00081                 hunk->next = available_##NAME##s; \
00082                 available_##NAME##s = hunk; \
00083                 hunk++; \
00084             } \
00085             count -= num; \
00086         } \
00087     } \
00088     static struct NAME *alloc_##NAME(void) \
00089     { \
00090         struct NAME *result; \
00091         if (!available_##NAME##s) generate_##NAME##s(1); \
00092         if (!available_##NAME##s) return NULL; \
00093         result = (struct NAME *) available_##NAME##s; \
00094         available_##NAME##s = available_##NAME##s->next; \
00095         total_##NAME##s++; \
00096         return result; \
00097     } \
00098     static void free_##NAME(struct NAME *i) \
00099     { \
00100         union allocator_##NAME##_un *x = (union allocator_##NAME##_un *) i; \
00101         x->next = available_##NAME##s; \
00102         available_##NAME##s = x; \
00103         total_##NAME##s--; \
00104     }
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 MAKE_ALLOCATOR(hash_entry)
00108 
00109 
00110 /* Linked list of all hash tables we are managing. */
00111 static struct hash_tab *hash_table_list = NULL;
00112 
00113 
00114 /* These are the generic hashtable routines.  They _require_ that the first
00115    member of the entry be a string, and that string is taken as the key.
00116    The generic delete function simply free's it's argument. */
00117 int compare_generic_hash(const void *entry1, const void *entry2)
00118 {
00119     const char *str1 = (const char *) entry1;
00120     const char *str2 = (const char *) entry2;
00121     if (str1 == str2)
00122         return 0;               /* Same string. */
00123 
00124     if (!str1)
00125         str1 = "";
00126     if (!str2)
00127         str2 = "";
00128 
00129     while (*str1 && tolower(*str1) == tolower(*str2)) {
00130         str1++;
00131         str2++;
00132     }
00133 
00134     return ((unsigned char) tolower(*str1)) -
00135         ((unsigned char) tolower(*str2));
00136 }
00137 
00138 
00139 unsigned long make_key_generic_hash(const void *entry)
00140 {
00141     const char *s = (const char *) entry;
00142     unsigned long hashval;
00143 
00144     if (!s)
00145         return 0;
00146 
00147     for (hashval = 0; *s != '\0'; s++)
00148         hashval = (((unsigned int) *s) | 0x20) + 31 * hashval;
00149 
00150     return hashval;
00151 }
00152 
00153 
00154 void delete_generic_hash(void *entry)
00155 {
00156     FREE(entry);
00157 }
00158 
00159 
00160 static unsigned long compute_hash(hash_tab * table, const void *data)
00161 {
00162     return (table->keyfn(data) % table->size);
00163 }
00164 
00165 
00166 static struct hash_entry *find_hash_internal(hash_tab * table,
00167                                              const unsigned long hashval,
00168                                              const void *match,
00169                                              struct hash_entry
00170                                              ***return_prev)
00171 {
00172     struct hash_entry *curr;
00173     struct hash_entry **prev;
00174     compare_function cmpfn;
00175     int visits = 0;
00176 
00177     if (!table)
00178         return NULL;
00179 
00180     cmpfn = table->cmpfn;
00181 
00182     prev = &(table->table[hashval]);
00183     for (curr = *prev; curr; prev = &(curr->next), curr = curr->next) {
00184         visits++;
00185         if (cmpfn(match, curr->data) == 0) {
00186             if (!table->inside_walk) {
00187                 /* Move this entry to the head of the bucket. */
00188                 *prev = curr->next;
00189                 curr->next = table->table[hashval];
00190                 table->table[hashval] = curr;
00191                 prev = &(table->table[hashval]);
00192             }
00193 
00194             /* Mark this hit for statistics. */
00195             table->hits_visited += visits;
00196             table->hits++;
00197 
00198             if (return_prev)
00199                 *return_prev = prev;
00200             return curr;
00201         }
00202     }
00203 
00204     table->misses_visited += visits + 1;
00205     table->misses++;
00206 
00207     return NULL;                /* not found */
00208 }
00209 
00210 
00211 void *find_hash_entry(hash_tab * table, const void *match)
00212 {
00213     struct hash_entry *entry;
00214 
00215     entry =
00216         find_hash_internal(table, compute_hash(table, match), match, NULL);
00217 
00218     return (entry) ? (void *) (entry->data) : NULL;
00219 }
00220 
00221 
00222 int add_hash_entry(hash_tab * table, const void *data)
00223 {
00224     struct hash_entry *entry;
00225     unsigned long hashval;
00226 
00227     if (!table)
00228         return 1;
00229 
00230     hashval = compute_hash(table, data);
00231 
00232     entry = find_hash_internal(table, hashval, data, NULL);
00233 
00234     if (entry) {
00235         /* Free old entry. */
00236         table->delfn((void *) entry->data);
00237     } else {
00238         entry = alloc_hash_entry();
00239         if (!entry) {
00240             fprintf(stderr, "Error adding hash entry: %s\n",
00241                     strerror(errno));
00242             return 1;
00243         }
00244         entry->next = table->table[hashval];
00245         table->table[hashval] = entry;
00246 
00247         table->entries++;
00248         if (table->entries > table->max_entries)
00249             table->max_entries = table->entries;
00250         table->total_insert++;
00251     }
00252 
00253     /* Either we just created it, or we already found a valid one. */
00254     entry->data = data;
00255     return 0;
00256 }
00257 
00258 
00259 void clear_hash_entry(hash_tab * table, const void *data)
00260 {
00261     struct hash_entry *entry;
00262     struct hash_entry **prev;
00263     unsigned long hashval;
00264 
00265     if (!table)
00266         return;
00267 
00268     hashval = compute_hash(table, data);
00269 
00270     entry = find_hash_internal(table, hashval, data, &prev);
00271 
00272     if (!entry)
00273         return;
00274 
00275     /* Found one.  Remove from linked list. */
00276     *prev = entry->next;
00277 
00278     /* If entry was the next location in a hash walk, skip it. */
00279     if (table->walk_loc == entry) {
00280         table->walk_loc = entry->next;
00281     }
00282 
00283     table->entries--;
00284 
00285     table->delfn((void *) entry->data);
00286     free_hash_entry(entry);
00287 }
00288 
00289 
00290 void free_hash_table(hash_tab * table)
00291 {
00292     struct hash_entry **temp;   /* In the table array. */
00293     struct hash_entry *entry, *next;
00294     unsigned long i, size;
00295 
00296     if (!table)
00297         return;
00298 
00299     size = table->size;
00300     temp = table->table;
00301     for (i = 0; i < size; i++, temp++) {
00302         for (entry = *temp; entry; entry = next) {
00303             next = entry->next; /* Save it, since we free next. */
00304             table->delfn((void *) entry->data);
00305             free_hash_entry(entry);
00306         }
00307     }
00308 
00309     /* Remove from our linked list of tables. */
00310     *(table->prev) = table->next;
00311     if (table->next)
00312         table->next->prev = table->prev;
00313 
00314     FREE(table->table);
00315     FREE(table);
00316 }
00317 
00318 void clear_hash_table(hash_tab * table)
00319 {
00320     struct hash_entry **temp;   /* In the table array. */
00321     struct hash_entry *entry, *next;
00322     unsigned long i, size;
00323 
00324     if (!table)
00325         return;
00326 
00327     size = table->size;
00328     temp = table->table;
00329     for (i = 0; i < size; i++, temp++) {
00330         for (entry = *temp; entry; entry = next) {
00331             next = entry->next; /* Save it, since we free next. */
00332             table->delfn((void *) entry->data);
00333             free_hash_entry(entry);
00334         }
00335     }
00336 
00337     /* Clear out the actual table. */
00338     temp = table->table;
00339     for (i = 0; i < size; i++, temp++)
00340         *temp = NULL;
00341 
00342     table->entries = 0;
00343 }
00344 
00345 hash_tab *init_hash_table(const char *id, compare_function cmpfn,
00346                           key_function keyfn, delete_function delfn,
00347                           unsigned long size)
00348 {
00349     hash_tab *table;
00350     struct hash_entry **temp;
00351     unsigned long i;
00352 
00353     /* Malloc everything. */
00354     MALLOC(table, hash_tab, 1);
00355     if (!table) {
00356         fprintf(stderr, "malloc( %d ): %s\n",(int) sizeof(hash_tab),
00357                 strerror(errno));
00358         return 0;
00359     }
00360     MALLOC(table->table, struct hash_entry *, size);
00361     if (!table->table) {
00362         fprintf(stderr, "malloc(%lu): %s\n",
00363                 sizeof(struct hash_entry *) * size, strerror(errno));
00364         return 0;
00365     }
00366 
00367     /* Clear out the actual table. */
00368     temp = table->table;
00369     for (i = 0; i < size; i++, temp++)
00370         *temp = NULL;
00371 
00372     /* Fill in everything. */
00373     table->id = id;
00374     table->cmpfn = cmpfn;
00375     table->keyfn = keyfn;
00376     table->delfn = delfn;
00377     table->size = size;
00378     table->walk_key = 0;
00379     table->walk_loc = NULL;
00380     table->inside_walk = 0;
00381     table->entries = 0;
00382     table->max_entries = 0;
00383     table->hits = 0;
00384     table->hits_visited = 0;
00385     table->misses = 0;
00386     table->misses_visited = 0;
00387     table->total_insert = 0;
00388 
00389     /* Stick in our linked list of hash tables. */
00390     if (hash_table_list)
00391         hash_table_list->prev = &(table->next);
00392     table->next = hash_table_list;
00393     table->prev = &hash_table_list;
00394     hash_table_list = table;
00395 
00396     return table;
00397 }
00398 
00399 
00400 /* Can do lookups during a walk, but insertions and deletions may
00401     cause problems. */
00402 void init_hash_walk(hash_tab * table)
00403 {
00404     table->walk_key = 0;
00405     table->walk_loc = NULL;
00406     table->inside_walk = 1;
00407 }
00408 
00409 
00410 void *next_hash_walk(hash_tab * table)
00411 {
00412     struct hash_entry **temp;
00413     const void *result;
00414     unsigned long i, size;
00415 
00416     if (table->walk_loc) {
00417         result = table->walk_loc->data;
00418         table->walk_loc = table->walk_loc->next;
00419         return (void *) result;
00420     }
00421 
00422     size = table->size;
00423     temp = table->table + table->walk_key;
00424 
00425     for (i = table->walk_key; i < size; i++, temp++) {
00426         if (*temp)
00427             break;
00428     }
00429 
00430     if (i == table->size) {
00431         table->inside_walk = 0;
00432         return NULL;
00433     }
00434 
00435     result = (*temp)->data;
00436     table->walk_loc = (*temp)->next;
00437     table->walk_key = i + 1;
00438 
00439     return (void *) result;
00440 }
00441 
00442 
00443 void dump_hashtab_stats(hash_tab * table)
00444 {
00445     int doing_all = 0;
00446     long total_ratio, hit_ratio, miss_ratio;
00447     double t;
00448 
00449     if (table == NULL) {
00450         /* Dump information on all of the hashtables. */
00451         doing_all = 1;
00452         table = hash_table_list;
00453     }
00454 
00455     for (; table; table = table->next) {
00456         if (table->hits_visited + table->misses_visited) {
00457             t = 1000 *
00458                 (((double) table->hits_visited +
00459                   (double) table->misses_visited) / ((double) table->hits +
00460                                                      (double) table->
00461                                                      misses));
00462             total_ratio = t;
00463         } else
00464             total_ratio = 0;
00465         if (table->hits_visited) {
00466             t = 1000 * ((double) table->hits_visited /
00467                         (double) table->hits);
00468             hit_ratio = t;
00469         } else
00470             hit_ratio = 0;
00471         if (table->misses_visited) {
00472             t = 1000 * ((double) table->misses_visited /
00473                         (double) table->misses);
00474             miss_ratio = t;
00475         } else
00476             miss_ratio = 0;
00477 
00478         log_info("\n");
00479         log_info("--- Statistics for: %s\n", table->id);
00480         log_info("Table size: %ld.  Entries: %ld.\n",
00481                  table->size, table->entries);
00482         log_info("Total accesses: %ld.\n", table->hits + table->misses);
00483         log_info("Hit accesses: %ld.  Miss accesses: %ld.\n",
00484                  table->hits, table->misses);
00485         log_info("Bucket probes requiring comparison: %ld\n",
00486                  table->hits_visited + table->misses_visited);
00487         log_info("Hit compares: %ld.  Miss compares: %ld.\n",
00488                  table->hits_visited, table->misses_visited);
00489 
00490         /* the closer this is to 1000 the better the hash fxn */
00491         log_info("Total access ratio: %ld (/1000)\n", total_ratio);
00492         log_info("Hit ratio: %ld.  Miss ratio: %ld. (/1000)\n",
00493                  hit_ratio, miss_ratio);
00494         log_info("Max entries stored: %ld.\n", table->max_entries);
00495 
00496         if (!doing_all)
00497             break;
00498     }
00499 }

00502 long total_hash_entries(void)
00503 {
00504     /* #### MAKE_ALLOCATOR can't pluralize well :) */
00505     return total_hash_entrys;
00506 }

00509 void init_hash_entries(const long count)
00510 {
00511     /* #### MAKE_ALLOCATOR can't pluralize well :) */
00512     generate_hash_entrys(count);
00513 }
00514 
00515 extern long num_hash_entries(hash_tab * table)
00516 {
00517     return table->entries;
00518 }
